column5: My wife and I are off to Totem Lodge tomorrow to take our new(first) boat out for it's maiden voyage over our long weekend. It's our 30th anniversary and her birthday, we are staying in there Executive Island Cabin and using their guide with our boat to get a bit of a lesson on the boat etc.
Happy 30th, happy bday to wife and happy inaugural boat anniversary. Great idea w the guide, I'm sure you'll look to learn how he uses the electronics. What kind of boat did you buy?
A Lund Rebel 1750 XS Sport with a 115hp Merc, looking forward to getting some time with the Lowrance unit and the finer points of the trolling motor. Hoping for a great weekend.

Weather for this weekend is looking good. No big winds in forecast and high sun. Water temps at 55 in 30 ft of water. Many boats and people around awaiting opener. Have a good time in Sioux Narrows Sent from my SM-N910W8 using Tapatalk
Thanks, sure hope to. We get in tomorrow afternoon.

Had a great time at Totem, although we actually fished closer to Wiley Point Lodge. The walleye were very deep, often in 40' of water. Over the two days my wife and I caught about 60 fish split between Walleye and pike with a couple of smallmouth, one nice maybe 4 pounds and a fluky 24.5 inch Whitefish. Our guide Marc Lalonde was awesome, it was really cool the way he handled out boat in tight quarters while we were fishing in high winds and the way he used the electronics.

That's great news I was fishing in the Wiley area did not have much luck as I was trying the normal shallower post spawn areas. Thought about going deeper but ran out of daylight. Did not try many spots over 20 ft. I see other reports that 30 ft was productive as well. That wind was difficult on sundaySent from my SM-N910W8 using Tapatalk
That was really our first day out in our new boat, Marc Lalonde was our guide and he showed us a lot. I was listening to him talking to the other guides, they were only finding them deep.
